DOC.brief_title: Assessing Medicaid Randomized Insurance Experiment Within Community Clinics
DOC.detailed_description: In 2008 , Oregon Medicaid program use `` lottery '' ( Oregon Experiment ) allocate limit insurance resource low income adult categorically qualify traditional Medicaid coverage . Thousands randomly select apply Medicaid ; many others select . This `` natural policy experiment '' first population-level randomization insurance coverage since Rand 's 1971-1982 experiment . We use data safety net clinic share common electronic health record ( EHR ) operate OCHIN , non-profit organization Portland , Oregon . As one nation 's large link community health center network , OCHIN EHR database record nearly visit safety net clinic Oregon one patient chart link across > 100 community health center . We link Medicaid claim data OCHIN database determine patient applied participate Oregon Experiment , well determine gain insurance via experiment . We test hypothesis public insurance coverage associate high rate receive preventive care service increase healthcare utilization among person usual source primary care . To end , analyze preventive care utilization pattern among OCHIN clinic patient affect Oregon 's Medicaid Experiment . This study capitalize two unique opportunity : EHR database link > 100 community health center , quasi-experimental design Oregon 's randomize Medicaid experiment . The specific aim relate Oregon Experiment : 1 ) To compare post-intervention rate preventive service receipt among OCHIN patient randomize Oregon Experiment group ( intervention group ) , compare coverage group ( comparison group ) ; 3 ) To compare post-intervention rate ambulatory healthcare utilization among OCHIN patient randomize Oregon Experiment group ( intervention group ) , compare coverage group ( comparison group ) .
